programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Hurricane Michael hits Florida, a group of fishermen capsize in rough seas and a police officer is hurt by a car careering out of control in the snow.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at how the lives of FedEx flight 705's crew were placed in jeopardy when they came under attack from a hijacker above Memphis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is excited when a clergyman sells him a rare baseball signed by Babe Ruth, complete with authentication papers - and knows it could be worth several thousand dollars.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a 160-year-old Tiffany watch, which has no identifying markings other than the name on its face. The pressing question is how the company verify that it is genuine.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The swampers venture out in a storm, but while one team uses the weather to its advantage, another hunter suffers a tragic accident.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The battle royal with Mother Nature continues as the Ice Road Truckers fight through the storm of the century. Art, Todd and Lisa press their luck on ice that is buckling under the weight of heavy snow..

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are delighted when they visit a house packed with rare collectibles - but are less pleased by the prices the owner is asking for them.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. Seth rushes to sell the sports memorabilia after spending a fortune at an auction. Meanwhile, Les checks out a Starfire convertible.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth has his eye on a valuable guitar, a customer tries to buy a fancy watch, and Les strikes a deal.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: An investigation into whether Earth's deepest caves could contain secret conduits to other worlds, or harbour evidence that aliens once visited the planet.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts question if there really is an elite group of powerbrokers trying to rule the planet - and if so, ascertain those behind such a new world order.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A team of experts investigates whether governments around the world are using weather control to incite the next global war, and possibly destroy the planet.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A famous cowboy offers his assistance to the bidders at an auction in Fort Worth, while Lesa finds a means to triumph over her rival.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: One of the buyers accidentally acquires a historically important item, while Victor gets his hands on an intriguing locked treasure chest - with no key.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When the security guards start spooking customers, Les sends them home to teach them a lesson.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a major deal with a new supplier for a truckload of TVs, before getting excited about rare Detroit Tigers baseball memorabilia.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick tries to persuade his father to buy a helicopter, before checking a 240-year-old lottery ticket that may have been signed by George Washington.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers assess the value of a spoon made by silversmith and American Revolution patriot Paul Revere, a cuckoo clock from the 1800s and a mysterious vintage archery bow.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Compton, Mike buys something that Herb does not want to be anywhere near. Jarrod ends up with a new nickname while Barry and his old pal Kenny reunite.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive purchase in the history of the series at an auction in Orange.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton arrive at an auction separately, but a common enemy and the discovery of professional go-karts may bring them back together.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen head to auction while the employees throw an Appraisal Event. Both plans go awry, so the guys hit a yard sale. Will their findings serve up a profit?.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders consider the benefits and drawbacks of two very different neighbourhoods, and Lesa displays her ruthless side while dealing with a young buyer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A piano, a tea set and some expensive furniture are among the finds up for grabs when the buyers go to Lewisville, Texas.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Examining the mega-tornado which tore a path of destruction through Oklahoma City in May 1999, and questioning what would happen if similar winds were to strike Dallas.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: After the successes of animal cloning, experts assess when human cloning may become possible.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts ask if the bigfoot - a half-man, half-ape - is simply a figment of the imagination, or if he is being hidden from the public eye.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts make surprising discoveries as they explore the ancient past for evidence of alien overseers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has stainless steel jewellery coming to the shop, but Ashley refuses to sell it - until she is forced to do so by her cousin Karen.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Cousin Karen is ready to shake things up on the showroom floor, but Ashley is less than thrilled to have someone invading her turf.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Les takes his niece Karen under his wing to help out at the jewellery counter, Ashley fails to conceal her jealousy well.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth thinks Les is stuck in the past for hand-delivering their gold to a refinery, and bets his father that his new mail order service will improve things.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Things get worse when the shop's landlord appears, and Ton tries to negotiate with him while Allen puts an experimental parachute to the test.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen fight back when a storeowner seems intent on preventing them from scoring new items in Santa Barbara. Plus, the guys discover a vintage wooden boat.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must forge a fully functional serrated knife using steel from hand scissors, or risk getting cut from the competition.

programme.title: Forged: Man At Arms
programme.sub-title: Man at Arms: Art of War
programme.desc: Danny and the blacksmiths recreate the Kalis and the Kampilan - two ferocious blades from the ancient Philippines.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry is accompanied by two beautiful women to the auction, while newcomers Rene and Casey purchase a statue that could be worth thousands of dollars. Elsewhere, a professional wrestler appears at an appraisal.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend a locker auction at El Monte, California, where Jarrod and Brandi find their sense of charity and Barry unearths a bag that has him hitting the slopes.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the notoriously obscure quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Bill Bailey, Jo Brand and Greg Davies join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous marriage and mating matters.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Dane Baptiste, Desiree Burch, Chris McCausland
programme.desc: Award-winning stand-up comedian Dane Baptiste plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by New York comic Desiree Burch and Liverpool funnyman Chris McCausland.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, John Robins and Holly Walsh join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in July 2016.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Strictly judge Bruno Tonioli, Newsnight presenter Kirsty Wark and comedians Adam Buxton and Rob Beckett are this week's guests.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave investigates whether the queue's days are numbered, and carries out his own experiment to see how the audience react when someone pushes into a queue. He also wonders if anyone pays any attention to those footprints painted on the ground at cashpoints.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: A customer brings in a family war letter, describing a man's fear for his life before battle. And animal lover Marie investigates the story of a medal awarded for rescuing a dog.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Anne Frank and Eva Schloss, whose lives intertwined during the darkest of period of 20th-century history. Eva, who met Anne in Amsterdam in 1938, survived Auschwitz and here talks about her memories of the young diarist, her survival from the death camps, and how she became the step daughter of Anne's Father, Otto Frank.

programme.title: Samurai Warrior Queens
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary telling the story of Nakano Takeko, a female samurai who defied convention to lead a rebellion against Japan's western-influenced Emperor in 1868.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Lost Treasure of the Templars
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates whether the Knights Templar hid their treasure, looted from Jerusalem, on an uninhabited island in Mahone Bay, Nova Scotia.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind an abandoned Second World War aviation facility in Farnborough, a Soviet airbase in the Gobi Desert, and a disused furnace in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The surprising preventive and curative 'medicine' developed by certain species, including the hippopotamus, which secretes a red slime to act as a highly efficient sun screen.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Two families with remarkable powers of regenerating unusually large body parts easily - salamanders, which do so when a large chunk, such as the tail or a limb, has been bitten off by a predator, and male moose, which grow and shed antlers every year.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes the wildlife of the desert-like west and south of the island, an area where dry spells can last months and survival is a struggle. Verreaux's sifakas live among trees with potentially lethal spikes, while the baobab trees house mouse lemurs, primates that feed on the droppings of fluffy bugs. During the toughest time of year, gangs of ring-tailed lemurs try to raise their young, and as the rains arrive, the year-long life cycle of the Labord's chameleon begins.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Examining a fleet of cruise ships that are the largest passenger vessels in the world, and revealing how they have built on 19th-century experiments in hydrodynamics.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright comes up with a cunning plan and invents a Saint's day so that Granville can check the pockets of a foreign visitor who he suspects of shoplifting.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: An Errand Boy by the Ear
programme.desc: Arkwright decides Granville needs toughening up and starts dragging him around the store by his ear, but the regular customers are unhappy by what they see.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The search for an abducted student leads nowhere until a 'psychic adviser' to the missing girl's mother approaches the police, offering to help track her down. Burke grudgingly agrees to attend one of her shows and is stunned by the accuracy of information he is given about his father that no-one else could possibly know. Drama, starring Alex Norton and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: New eye-witness testimony and a television documentary about the McCready case casts doubt on the original murder investigation. DS Walker is suspended from duty and decides to return to Glasgow to find new evidence to prove his innocence, in order to save his career, relationship and reputation.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Snooker player Dennis Taylor asks Lovejoy for help finding a billiards table that once belonged to Mary Queen of Scots. Drama, also starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward explores the historic city of Warwick as part of her National Gardens Scheme tour, discovering medieval buildings and the gardens of Lord Leycester Hospital.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Those involved in Bert's death and its subsequent cover-up search for inner peace. Sarah battles her own demons, but is aware that Colin's suffering is greater. Meanwhile, James' treatment continues to cause him suffering and Jack is determined to find answers after Carolyn's revelation. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.sub-title: A Kiss to Build a Dream On
programme.desc: Elizabeth enlists Prudence's help, and on the eve of her engagement party, Sarah confides to her aunt about a shameful secret. Meanwhile, Anna and Gino's relationship moves forward and James' treatment takes a disturbing turn. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack takes over as superintendent in Adam's absence, and promotes Neil Manson to acting DCI - despite grave misgivings about his recent conduct. Gabriel publicly asks Sheelagh out for dinner, allaying her fears that their relationship is over, and Ramani is devastated to learn Terry has been having an affair with his sister-in-law. Affairs of the heart also preoccupy Dan Casper, who receives another poison pen letter - but decides to ignore it and continue his affair with Rochelle.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Helena develops complications following Nick's rushed surgery, putting Diane in a difficult position when she realises the problem should have been noticed during the first operation. Sam breaks the rules to help a recovering alcoholic who needs a heart transplant, and Justin tries to flirt with Kyla again. Jesse Birdsall guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A bogus paramedic causes chaos among the staff and patients of Holby City, and a mugging incident results in Adam having to reveal a secret. Medical drama, starring Ian Bleasdale and Cathy Shipton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Jack is forced to arrest his own son Benjamin for possession of drugs, and the corpulent form of convicted rapist Peter Baxter again crosses Sam's path as she helps Ramani investigate a nurse's disappearance. Gabriel invites Sheelagh back to his place in a bid to prove that he has finally managed to forget about Kerry Young, while Yvonne is summoned to hear her fate as the inquiry into the death of Lee Chapman concludes.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline and Arthur reflect on their marriage and parenting skills when their son Martin is suddenly taken to hospital. Pat moves in with Nick and her grandson much to Nigels dismay.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank and the Mitchell brothers take Sharon, Kathy and Pat to France on a booze cruise, will romance bloom for the couples or will it all end in classic EastEnders fashion.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy is rescued from a tank of caustic soda and rushed to hospital in agony while Nick returns to work just as a bombing campaign presents the team with a fresh challenge.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie's plans to organise a clan gathering, which include hiring a film crew, look set to be thwarted when pernickety Charles MacDonald throws a spanner in the works. Duncan and Jess struggle to admit their feelings for each other and Molly prepares to make a confession. Scottish drama, starring Dawn Steele and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A humiliated and jealous Evelyn exacts revenge by spreading the sordid secrets of Karen's past around Skelthwaite and patients soon refuse to be treated by her, leaving it up to Anna to discover why a teenage epileptic continues to suffer attacks despite his medication. Simon struggles to cope with the preparations for his forthcoming wedding and proves easy prey for Evelyn, who seems intent on wreaking as much havoc as she can.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sisters Sharon and Tracey's lives are changed for ever when their husbands leave for work and never return. First episode of the popular comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie puts Marlene under pressure to fit in with the locals, so she decides to take up cookery - an idea that does not go down well with her family. She orders her husband to pick blackberries for a pie, causing him to inadvertently trespass on the land of his anti-English neighbour. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but the tense atmosphere between them does not prevent a visit from her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy accepts Sid's challenge to play a round of golf - despite not having touched a club since 1939. Brian Wilde and Sid Comer star.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The duo are called out to a private zoo, where human remains have been found in the tigers' den. The evidence points to an unfortunate accident, but Dalziel suspects foul play - and a connection to a mysterious disappearance he investigated 20 years previously. Detective drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the killing of notorious biker-gang leader Eddie Chapman when his son's girlfriend brings them new information about his death. She reveals her partner must avenge his father's murder as part of a final initiation into the gang, but believes the wrong man is being targeted. Meanwhile, Sandra is forced to reassess her position at Ucos when a former colleague suggests she is wasting her career. Starring Amanda Redman, with her real-life daughter Emily Glenister in a supporting role.

credits.actor: her real-life daughter Emily Glenister in a supporting role

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd is unsettled when Sarah Cavendish (played by Five Daughters star Eva Birthistle), an officer of equal rank to him, joins the team to investigate the disappearance of a banker who had been struggling to cope with losing his daughter to cancer. Though Cavendish's professional skills quickly prove to be a major asset, her new colleagues discover that a failed operation from earlier in her career is continuing to haunt her, and become concerned for her welfare. Trevor Eve stars, with Sue Johnston and Tara FitzGerald.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: A Very British Lockdown: Diaries from the Frontline
programme.desc: Documentary featuring a wide cross-section of people as they record their own stories on camera phones - charting the everyday courage, kindness, anxiety and humour they experience as the nation strives to 'Keep Calm and Carry On'. From shopkeepers to home-schooling parents, care workers to cleaners, teachers to nurses, the film reveals what HM The Queen recently called 'our quiet, good humoured resolve'. Others - such as expectant Mums and the sick and elderly - show their bravery in the face of the coronavirus.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Christine Lampard, Stacey Solomon, Nadia Sawalha and Jane Moore are joined by EastEnders star Lacey Turner, who chats about her difficult pregnancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James samples the culinary delights of Northern Ireland with friend and fellow chef Paul Rankin, visiting a wasabi farm and a honey producer. James cooks overlooking the dramatic backdrop of Slieve Gullion - the highest point in Armagh - before the pair visit Lough Neagh.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five police officers answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ian, Sally, Kayleigh and Peter pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn is shocked when the foster parents arrive and accuse Will of threatening them, while Jamie secretly plans to meet up with Belle, and Vanessa asks Rhona to be Johnny's guardian in the event of her death.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Yasmeen receives a shocking diagnosis from Dr Gaddas, leading Geoff to immediately accuse her of infidelity, while Dev makes matters worse for Asha, who begs him to withdraw his complaints. Gary warns Claire that if Rick finds out she has been pocketing his cash, he is likely to kill her.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team head to Shrewsbury in Shropshire to meet former nurse Gina Constable, who has raised over a quarter of a million pounds for the Air Ambulance charity over the past 21 years. Inspired by the wishes of her late husband, the team set to work transforming her garden into a breathtaking Japanese-inspired outdoor space, complete with cloud-pruned trees and Japanese maples.

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a spin-off from The Chase in which contestants take on two, three, four or all five of the quiz's resident experts Mark Labbett, Anne Hegerty, Paul Sinha, Jenny Ryan and Shaun Wallace at once. Members of the audience are called out to face five multiple choice questions, with the chance to bank up to 5,000, but if they get the first question wrong they are out. Next, contestants are given the option of playing between two and all five Chasers for increasing amounts of money, but with a decreasing time advantage against them..

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: For the final leg of their US jaunt, the trio arrive in Texas, a meat-lover's paradise where Gordon Ramsay is keen to introduce his companions to some of the best barbecue food known to man. In Lexington, Gordon turns lumberjack in an attempt to fell a dead oak - which is used to infuse ovens with wood smoke. There's a break for a bit of skinny dipping, before the trio fish go fishing, and stay in a strange cabin deep in the woods, surviving on beans and bourbon. They then hit the state capital of Austin, dressing as cowboys in the local bar and at the rodeo, before one last barbecue supper of slow-smoked beef brisket, pork ribs and spicy sausage.

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a spin-off from The Chase in which contestants take on two, three, four or all five of the quiz's resident experts Mark Labbett, Anne Hegerty, Paul Sinha, Jenny Ryan and Shaun Wallace at once. Members of the audience are called out to face five multiple choice questions, with the chance to bank up to 5,000, but if they get the first question wrong they are out. Next, contestants are given the option of playing between two and all five Chasers for increasing amounts of money, but with a decreasing time advantage against them..

programme.title: Magic At The Movies
programme.desc: It's a Magic movie special! We have a collection of gorgeous classic movie soundtracks to score your day.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Feelgood Mornings
programme.desc: We're here to make you feel good this morning with some of the greatest tracks of all time.

programme.title: Step Into 1994
programme.desc: Take a step back in time to 1994, as we play you all the biggest hits from the year.

programme.title: This Is...Britney Spears
programme.desc: Join us for the amazing Britney Spears! Let's see some of her greatest hits..Gimme more.

programme.title: This Is...Justin Timberlake
programme.desc: There is no need to cry me a river, we have some of the greatest hits from the amazing Justin Timberlake.

programme.title: That's So Magic
programme.desc: Keep it here on Magic for all your favourite videos from the biggest artists ever.

programme.title: The Boyband Club
programme.desc: From Backstreet Boys to Boyzone, from Westlife to N*Sync: join The Boyband Club and immerse yourself in all their greatest pop hits.

programme.title: That's So Magic

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Darrell and the team head to a mysterious island where they discover valuable clues that lead them closer in the hunt to a 500-year-old shipwreck.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: The final member of Farley Dean's gold-mining crew arrives on Bougainville Island, but a reckless decision by Farley divides the crew and jeopardises the mission.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: Intriguing images picked up by satellite, including a huge set of arrows in the badlands of the American West and a blood-red waterfall staining Antarctica's snows.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: Hair Club for Men - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Paul Sr's new client makes him think twice about his hair, but he may not be taking his family therapy session as seriously. Paul Jr reveals his latest build to 400,000 delighted fans.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Kevin poses as an interviewer to gain access to a Westwind jet, Ken and Danny valet a car to get the keys to a Cessna CJ3, and Mike repos an air ambulance.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits the state of Delaware, where he tries to make scrapple - a local delicacy manufactured from pig livers. He also learns about a particular type of shoe shine.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Electric Stand-Up Vehicles/Frozen Fruit/Beer Coasters/Forged Door Handle
programme.desc: A look at how objects including electric stand-up vehicles, beer coasters and forged door handles are manufactured.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Investigating how rock crushers, fabric lampshades, cake sprinkles and steam irons are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into large-scale iron-mining operations in the Australian Outback. Plus, how the world's biggest wave machine is used for flood defences.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: On a trip to Barcelona to buy antiques Drew Pritchard uncovers an early, two-door Range Rover. In Hampshire, he and Paul Cowland disagree on how to restore a Porsche 944.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The opilio crab season ends with a harrowing mayday call, while Edgar Hansen, after 22 years in the industry, snaps and confronts his older brother and captain Sig.

programme.title: Trawler Wars
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the fleet to win big before Christmas and Shiney risks going the distance for Dover Sole. The Newlyn and Brixham crews crown their top grossing skippers, and the Navy search-and-rescue team aids a Spanish sailor in anaphylactic shock.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to double his money by working with expert mechanic Edd China to turn an Austin-Healey Frogeye Sprite into a quality classic car. Once completed, the duo test-drive it around the Brooklands Motor Museum in Surrey, prior to selling it on at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer wants a high-performance car with a historic badge, but it proves difficult to find a Saab 9-3 Turbo at a good price for mechanic Edd China to refurbish.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne thinks he's found the best 100m Austin Healey anywhere in the world and hopes to get top dollar for it and two special Morgans at auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne flies to Maryland to inspect a collection including a Jaguar XKE, an Austin Healy 3000 and a Lincoln Continental.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How modern-day objects are created. This time, how islanders of the Outer Hebrides use pedal power to weave Harris tweed, and how fermented shark is prepared.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How deliveries are made to the International Space Station, and the processes used to make the world's most expensive and luxurious beds.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Following fishing crews through the highs and lows of the competitive and risky abalone season in Port Lincoln, South Australia.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: In this two-hour special, two new skippers join the fleet to take on the treacherous Bering Sea, and invade the Wizard's crab grounds.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: When other businesses move with the times, Drew Pritchard sees a chance to buy their unwanted stuff. In Essex, he finds a rare 1930s desk from a closing department store.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Blacksmith Neville has his expert skills tested with the restoration of a cast iron 19th-century fireplace. Plus, Alex restores a 1930s table into a farmhouse centrepiece.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China is stunned when Mike Brewer shows him his latest purchase, an unroadworthy VW Beetle, and decides to turn it into a beach buggy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The beach buggy project is completed and Edd China takes it for a test drive before Mike Brewer tries to sell it on for a profit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours a Surrey sculpture park, where a pair of rare 18th-century church lych-gates catches his eye. In London, he visits a small showroom with big character.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a manor house in Oxfordshire, where the classic exterior hides a weird and wonderful interior in which he hopes to uncover some priceless gems.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Boulder Boys Aaron and Ron almost lose their $60,000 excavator on unstable ground. Off-the-grid opal hunting family The McFarlanes race a storm in Lightning Ridge.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Superbowl fever hits The Cornelia Marie, an injured crewman causes problems on the Wizard, the Cape Caution makes an almost fatal error, while the Time Bandit loses a Captain.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How phosphates are used to put out fires, and the processes involved in refuelling and resupplying cruise liners.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they mine marble for Washington's monuments, how do they make Tabasco Sauce, and how do they produce storm proof umbrellas?.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Medic Jan Garavaglia tries to solve the mystery surrounding the case of disabled woman who had a fatal seizure shortly after being released from hospital.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A case in which a family objected to an autopsy of a man who died in a fall on religious grounds. Plus, a florist's death that proved puzzling.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor encounters a girl who claims contaminated well-water killed her father. Plus, a man dies after complaining of severely aching knees - did he overdose on pain relief - or was he ill?.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the evidence that will determine exactly what happened when a 43-year-old man took a nap at his parents' house, and was later found dead in bed. Plus, a 53-year-old woman found dead on her sofa.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: FBI agents track down bank robbers and a desperate fugitive who plundered thousands of dollars and started a crime wave.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA team embarks upon the huge task of removing birds from a live crime scene. Plus, Debbie Michelson makes an intervention into a family overrun with dogs.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A woman takes her puppy for a check-up and discovers it needs major heart surgery. Following the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to save two baby Tasmanian devils that are close to death following a mysterious illness, and a miniature schnauzer when it is attacked by a puffer fish.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sahar visits the salon with one wedding dress in mind, while Kristin returns for her fitting, but it is not the same outfit she originally bought.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride and her sister disagree about the bridesmaids wearing a form-fitting dress, while another battles with her mother about necklines.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bridesmaid searching for a husband threatens to leave the bridal party is she is not able to show off her body in a short dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney vet Dr Chris Brown attempts to help a lady who runs a shelter for abandoned donkeys. Lisa takes on a six-year-old apprentice who has arrived at Sash with her sick dog, Jelly.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown pays a visit to Kyabram Vet Clinic in the state of Victoria to lend a hand to an old friend.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators intervene to save 30 hungry horses in one of the biggest and most challenging rescues ever for the team.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigators raid a property that they suspect is being used to stage illegal dog fights.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A search for a missing man uncovers a cold blooded murder. Plus, a couple uncover a dark secret when they find a shallow grave under their new house.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The disappearance of reporter, part-time dancer and single mother Susan Walsh, who vanished from outside her New Jersey home in 1996, leaving her son behind.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of 21-year-old Clinton Nelson, who went missing in September 2006 after heading to Louisiana to get to know his biological father and take a job in the oilfields.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists use forensic evidence to piece together the stories of soldiers who went to war but never returned.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: The sisters are touched by the stories of fathers of the bride who visit their shop, and decide they need to pay more attention to their own dad.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.sub-title: Brides That Inspire and a Project Prom Flyer
programme.desc: Yukia and Yuneisia are inspired by two brides who work to help others and collect dress donations for an appeal.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: The story of Amanda, a self-proclaimed 'daddy's girl' who has a huge budget for her wedding and will stop at nothing to get exactly what she wants.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride has lost five stone in preparation for her wedding, but still needs Jo and Al's help to feel confident in her appearance.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Things heat up for Emma's wedding in Portugal.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors spend a day at Villeurbanne flea market in Lyon with expert Mark Franks, before upcycling their items and selling their wares in Eastbourne, East Sussex.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, an unusual Harley-Davidson motorbike, an antique flapper purse and a pair of solid gold coins keep Dan and his assistant Ellie busy doing high-end deals. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, staff broker a deal on a fur coat and ring, and a 100-year-old music player.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Steven's addictions spiral and a risky decision is needed to save his life. As brother Justin accepts help, Dr Now tries to find the root of their issues.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The family recounts Robyn's journey as she joined the family and revisit the highlights of her first five years as Kody's fourth wife. They also acknowledge their initial jealousy of her.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Jo and Al show bride Ciara the perfect dress does not have to be way over budget, and after a mastectomy, bride Joanna has an ingenious way to get her curves back.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Levi has lost three dress sizes since she bought her 50s-style wedding dress, so Jo and Al try to find her one that fits. Plus, Caroline is losing sleep over her gown.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of an undercover operation, codenamed 'Safe Bet', which targeted corrupt police officers and their connections with the Chicago Mafia.
